docs.lead_paragraph: The bride expects to receive a master’s in public policy from Princeton this month. The groom is a lawyer in New York.
docs.snippet: The bride expects to receive a master’s in public policy from Princeton this month. The groom is a lawyer in New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Republicans and Democrats in Texas House and Senate hash out the details of the state’s 2014-15 budget, one issue they are not arguing about is support for mental health.

headline.main: With Consensus and Money, State Takes on Mental Health Care
headline.print_headline: With Consensus and Money, State Takes On Mental Health Care

docs.snippet: As Republicans and Democrats in Texas House and Senate hash out the details of the state’s 2014-15 budget, one issue they are not arguing about is support for mental health.

byline.original: By BRANDI GRISSOM and ALANA ROCHA

docs.lead_paragraph: Public awareness is raised, as are concerns about insurance coverage for preventive mastectomies.
docs.abstract: Editorial praises Angelina Jolie for publicly revealing her double mastectomy, noting it greatly raised public awareness of genetic testing she used, as well as concerns about insurance coverage for such testing; cautions not all women should undergo genetic testing, as unclear results may lead to unneeded surgery or treatments that have potential for serious harm.
docs.snippet: Public awareness is raised, as are concerns about insurance coverage for preventive mastectomies.

docs.lead_paragraph: The plan includes limiting the deductions and exclusions high-income families can claim, increasing taxes on tobacco products and adopting a new minimum tax on income over $1 million.

headline.main: Budget Office Says Obama Plan Would Cut Deficit by $1 Trillion
headline.print_headline: Budget Office Says Obama Plan Would Cut Deficit by $1 Trillion

docs.abstract: President Obama's budget proposal would cut more than $1.1 trillion from government's projected deficits over next 10 years; plan includes limiting deductions and exclusions high-income families can claim, increasing taxes on tobacco products and adopting new minimum tax on income over $1 million.
docs.snippet: The plan includes limiting the deductions and exclusions high-income families can claim, increasing taxes on tobacco products and adopting a new minimum tax on income over $1 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Bayonne Medical Center billed Medicare for common treatments at a rate more than four times the national average, according to a Times analysis of 2011 data.

headline.seo: Bayonne Medical Center Has Highest U.S. Billing Rates
headline.main: New Jersey Hospital Has Highest Billing Rates in the Nation
headline.print_headline:
Jersey Hospital
Is the Costliest
In the Nation

docs.abstract: New York Times analysis of 2011 data shows that Bayonne Medical Center, in Bayonne, NJ, is the most expensive hospital in America; based on the bills it submits to Medicare it charged the highest amounts in the country for nearly one-quarter of the most common hospital treatments; quality of care at Bayonne Medical, for the prices it typically charges, is no better, or worse, than that at most other New Jersey hospitals.
docs.snippet: The Bayonne Medical Center billed Medicare for common treatments at a rate more than four times the national average, according to a Times analysis of 2011 data.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL, BARRY MEIER and JO CRAVEN McGINTY

docs.lead_paragraph: Consumers need a clearer picture of costs to make rational decisions about medical care.

headline.seo: The Murky World of Hospital Prices
headline.main: The Murky World of Hospital Prices
headline.print_headline: The Murky World of Hospital Prices

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes federal government making public a vast trove of information on list prices charged by hospitals for array of procedures commonly performed on hospitalized patients, but contends that it falls short of providing full information that patients need to make informed decisions about their health care.
docs.snippet: Consumers need a clearer picture of costs to make rational decisions about medical care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Behind their loud condemnations of President Obama, Republicans continue to damage the economy and society.
docs.abstract: Editorial observes that details of troubles swirling around Obama administration are bluntly contradicting Republicans who want to combine them into seamless narrative of tyrannical government on rampage; contends that political windstorms are merely obscuring real damage that Republican obstruction continues to do to economy and workings of government.
docs.snippet: Behind their loud condemnations of President Obama, Republicans continue to damage the economy and society.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vast databases of patient and doctor information being used by drug makers let them know which medications physicians are prescribing and how they compare to colleagues.

headline.seo: A Data Trove Now Guides Drug Company Pitches
headline.main: Pills Tracked From Doctor to Patient to Aid Drug Marketing
headline.print_headline: Data Trove on Doctors Guides Drug Company Pitches

docs.abstract: Vast databases of patient and doctor information being used by drug makers let them know which medications physicians are prescribing and how they compare to colleagues; some doctors have expressed discomfort with idea of sensitive data being used to sell drugs, even though federal law requires that any personally identifiable information be removed; database provider IMS argues that system improves dialog between drug companies and health care providers.
docs.snippet: Vast databases of patient and doctor information being used by drug makers let them know which medications physicians are prescribing and how they compare to colleagues.

headline.main: Bipartisan House Group Reaches Preliminary Immigration Deal

docs.abstract: A House bipartisan group working on legislation to overhaul the nation’s immigration laws reached a deal in principle Thursday evening, aides said.
docs.snippet: A House bipartisan group working on legislation to overhaul the nation’s immigration laws reached a deal in principle Thursday evening, aides said.
